title: Week 1: The Moxie is moving
body:
That's right, folks... we're moving! By the time our three year anniversary rolls around on September 21st, we hope to be completely set up at our new location in the Wilhoit Plaza, just to the East of Ophelia's. If you're not sure where that is, check out the interactive map below: That's a mere 0.2722 miles, or roughly four football fields, to the East -- you can easily walk from door to door in less than five minutes. Now, I'm sure you're all curious as to the when, and why, and what for, which I'll cover in due time, but for now I just want to highlight a few of the added benefits of our new space.
OLD MOXIENEW MOXIE
One screenTwo screens
75 seats140+ seats
No discernible lobby, five folding chairsA real lobby, with tables, chairs, sofas, etc..
Bottled beverages, no ice, limited menuBottled beverages, beer on tap, fountain soda, ice, and an expanded menu
Two unisex restrooms with one stall eachSeparate men's and women's restrooms with at LEAST three stalls each
Reel-to-reel projectionDual platter system
And those are just the immediately obvious improvements! There are many more less-apparent benefits like increased foot traffic, programming flexibility, closer proximity to MSU, and the ability to ramp up our community outreach programs that I'll talk about over the course of the next few months. Our soft opening is tentatively scheduled for September 1st, with our full grand opening on the 5th, which means we only have 25 weeks to get everything done... as well as keep the Old Moxie up and running the entire time. It's going to be a stressful and exciting Summer, but if everything goes as planned, we'll all be able to enjoy a new and improved Moxie by Fall 2008. I'll be back in a day or two with more (hopefully some pictures too).
author: Dan

comments.author: Girl #2

I am *super* excited about this. moving is always bittersweet (and the present Moxie will be missed). but I think this move is going to be great. comments.author: evilvet
comments.body: When I am at the corporate googleplex, I have no reservations about tripping over an aisle of bodies to refill my vat of popcorn and empty my bladder, chatting on the cellphone and screaming at my kids all the while.  The Moxie is an entirely different experience.  I will hold my water, shut my mouth, and smash my cell phone if it so much dares to vibrate so as not to disturb my Moxie compatriots.  The Moxie crowd is sophisticated.  Therefore an intermission serves as a dedicated time where one can take care of business both personal and professional, talk about the movie so far, and get refills without interrupting fellow movie goers.  If you lose the intermission, the experience may be compromised as these abhorrent behaviors bleed into the auditorium.  Keep the intermission, please.
